title: Java StringcharAt()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java StringcharAt()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Java String
charAt
content_sections.content:
()
Method

Example
Return the first character (0) of a string:
String myStr = "Hello";
char result = myStr.charAt(0);
System.out.println(result);

Definition and Usage
The
charAt()
method returns the character at the specified index in a string.
The index of the first character is 0, the second character is 1, and so on.
Syntax
public char charAt(int
index
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
index
An
int
value representing the index of the character to return
Technical Details
Returns:
A
char
value at the specified index of this string.
The first char value is at index 0
Throws:

content_sections.title: IndexOutOfBoundsException
content_sections.content:
- if index is negative or not less than the length of 
  the specified string

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Java StringcharAt()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java StringcharAt()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java StringcharAt()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
